questions.question: What is a justification for expenditure of organizational resources, providing information about costs, benefits, options, risks, and issues?

explanation.Business case: A business case is a justification for expenditure of organizational resources, providing information about costs, benefits, options, risks, and issues.

questions.question: Who is responsible for continual improvement?
Which of the following statements is correct about the continual improvement register (CIR)?
options: There can be more than one CIR in an organization
There must only be a single CIR for the entire organization
The CIR should only be updated by a single group
CIR's are not needed in an organization
questions.answer: There can be more than one CIR in an organization

explanation.There can be more than one CIR in an org: There can be more than one CIR in an organization, as multiple CIR's can be maintained on individual, team, department, business unit, and organization levels.

questions.question: Where would an organization capture improvement ideas?

explanation.In the continual improvement register: Improvement ideas are captured, documented, assessed, and prioritized in the continual improvement register (CIR).

questions.question: Information security is critically dependent upon the... ?
options: Technology available to secured IT assets
Skill level of the IT service manager
Behavior of people throughout the organization
Type of security software used in the organization
questions.answer: Behavior of people throughout the organization

explanation.Behavior of people throughout the organi: Information security is critically dependent on the behavior of people throughout the organization.

questions.question: Information security management is primary driven by... ?
options: The most senior level in the organization
The type of security software available in the marketplace
questions.answer: The most senior level in the organization

explanation.The most senior level in the organizatio: Information security management must be driven from the most senior level in the organization, based on clearly understood governance requirements and organizational policies.

questions.question: When managing information security, an organization must strive to achieve a balance between protecting the organization and... ?

explanation.Allowing it to innovate: It is important to balance protection with enabling innovation; overly restrictive controls can harm an organization and prevent easy innovation.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about non-repudiation?
options: It's about ensuring that someone can deny that they took an action
It's about ensuring that someone can't deny that they took an action
It's about what actions an individual took
It has nothing to do with the actions of an individual
questions.answer: It's about ensuring that someone can't deny that they took an action

explanation.It's about ensuring that someone can't d: Non-repudiation is about ensuring that someone can't deny that they took an action.

questions.question: Change enablement balances the need to make beneficial changes and... ?
options: The method to implement the change
The evolving needs of the business

explanation.The adverse effect of changes: Change enablement balances the need to deliver additional value with the need to protect customers and users from adverse effects.

questions.question: Organizational change management manages the __________ aspects of changes to ensure that improvements and organizational transformations are implemented successfully.

explanation.People: Organizational change management focuses on the people aspects of change to ensure successful implementation of improvements and transformations.

questions.question: In high velocity organizations, it is common for change management practice to... ?
options: Be done by a single group
Be done by only senior management

explanation.Decentralize change approval: In high velocity organizations, decentralizing change approval is common, with peer review as a predictor of high performance.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an external factor in the four dimensions model?

explanation.Changes: The four dimensions model uses PESTEL external factors (political, economic, social, technological, legal, environmental); 'Changes' is not one of them.

questions.question: Which of the following supports the holistic approach to service management?

explanation.Four dimensions model: ITIL defines four dimensions that collectively support a holistic approach to the facilitation of value.

questions.question: Which of the following can lead to poor decision-making and in turn impact the organization's ability to improve internal capabilities?

explanation.Insufficient visibility of work: Insufficient visibility of work leads to poor decision-making and impacts the organization's ability to improve internal capabilities.

questions.question: Which guiding principle is about ensuring that service management includes understanding of how all parts of an organization work together?

explanation.Think and work holistically: This principle is about taking a holistic approach, including understanding how all parts of an organization work together in an integrated way.

questions.question: Which of the following refers to the steps an organization takes in the creation of value?

explanation.The service value chain: The ITIL service value chain includes six activities that represent the steps an organization takes in the creation of value.

questions.question: Which service value chain activity is done to provide a good understanding of stakeholder needs?

explanation.Engage: The engage activity provides a good understanding of stakeholders' needs, transparency, and ongoing engagement.

questions.question: What is the point of communication between the service provider and all its users?

explanation.Service Desk: The service desk is the point of communication between the service provider and all its users.

questions.question: What role is held accountable for the delivery of a specific service?

explanation.Service Owner: A service owner is a role that is held accountable for the delivery of a specific service.

questions.question: A risk assessment does not need to be repeated for which of the following changes?

explanation.Standard changes: A standard change does not need a risk assessment to be repeated each time the change is implemented.

questions.question: Which of the following coordinates the classification and ownership of incidents?

explanation.Service desk: Service desks provide a clear path for users to report issues, queries, and requests, and have them acknowledged, classified, owned, and actioned.

questions.question: Engage, plan, and improve are examples of?

explanation.Service value chain: The six value chain activities are: plan, improve, engage, design and transition, obtain/build, and deliver and support.

questions.question: Which is NOT a component of the service value system?

explanation.Four Dimensions: The service value system includes: service value chain, practices, guiding principles, governance, continual improvement.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct about effective incident management?
options: Often requires a high level of collaboration within and between teams
Often requires no collaboration between teams
Often requires collaboration only between certain teams
Only requires collaboration between the service desk and change management
questions.answer: Often requires a high level of collaboration within and between teams

explanation.Often requires a high level of collabora: Effective incident management often requires a high level of collaboration within and between teams.

questions.question: Which of the following practices has a major influence on how users perceive services?

explanation.Service desk: The service desk has a major influence on user experience and how the service provider is perceived by the users.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of an operational metric?

explanation.Service deployment times: Operational metrics are low-level indicators such as availability, incident response and fix times, and request processing times.

questions.question: Service request fulfillment generally includes which of the following types of changes?

explanation.Standard change: Fulfillment of service requests may include changes to services or their components; usually these are standard changes.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct about service request fulfillment?
options: Should be standardized and automated to the greatest degree possible
Should not be automated and allow users to implement the changes themselves
Should only be automated if users agree
Automation should not be an option when requesting a change
questions.answer: Should be standardized and automated to the greatest degree possible

explanation.Should be standardized and automated to: Service requests and their fulfillment should be standardized and automated to the greatest degree possible.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a service request?
options: Delaying the deployment of a new service
Giving feedback compliments and complaints about services
questions.answer: Giving feedback compliments and complaints about services

explanation.Giving feedback compliments and complain: Each service request may include feedback, compliments, and complaints.

questions.question: Which deployment approach allows for frequent customer feedback?

explanation.Continuous delivery: Continuous delivery is when components are integrated, tested, and deployed when they are needed, providing frequent opportunities for customer feedback loops.

questions.question: A router was recently upgraded with new memory. Which of the following involves moving the router back to a live environment?

explanation.Deployment management: Deployment management is to move new or changed hardware, software, documentation, processes, or any other component to live environments.

questions.question: What practice helps to optimize the use of valuable resources?

explanation.IT asset management: IT asset management helps optimize the use of valuable resources.

questions.question: An IT asset is any __________ valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or service.

explanation.Financially: An IT asset is any financially valuable component that can contribute to the delivery of an IT product or service.

questions.question: What is it called when new or changed components are deployed to just part of the production environment at a time?

explanation.Phased deployment: Phased deployment is when the new or changed components are deployed to just part of the production environment at a time.

questions.question: New software has been made available on the network and users are able to install it at a time that is convenient for them. What deployment approach is this?

explanation.Pull deployment: Pull deployment is when new or changed software is made available in a controlled repository, and users download the software to client devices when they choose.

questions.question: Change enablement must balance the need to make beneficial changes along with the... ?
options: Products and services needed for the changes

explanation.Adverse effect of changes: Change enablement must balance delivering additional value with the need to protect customers and users from the adverse effect of changes.

questions.question: It is common practice to use a decentralized change approval process in what type of organization?

explanation.High-velocity organization: In high-velocity organizations, it is a common practice to decentralize change approval, making the peer review a top predictor of high performance.

questions.question: The IT department will be installing a new application to all users over the weekend. What deployment approach is this?

explanation.Big Bang deployment: A Big Bang deployment is when new or changed components are deployed to all targets at the same time.

questions.question: Events are often classified as which of the following? 1. Informational 2. Warning 3. Exceptions

explanation.All of the above: Events are often classified as informational, warning, and exceptions.

questions.question: The ITIL SVS includes how many general management practices?

explanation.14: The ITIL SVS includes 14 general management practices, 17 service management practices, and 3 technical management practices.
